seniority_level.evidence: Job requires 3+ years as a data scientist and 5+ years of Python experience, plus responsibility for production ML models and leading a team of data scientists.

job_family.evidence: Title is "Data Scientist" and responsibilities focus on modeling, analytics, and ML.

sub_specialty.evidence: Role emphasizes predictive modeling for insurance claims, model performance tracking, and building data pipelines.

leadership_expectation.evidence: Description says "Build and support a team of data scientists and analysts" and mentions steering product development, indicating technical leadership without explicit people‑management duties.

primary_cloud.evidence: No cloud provider (AWS, Azure, GCP) is referenced in the posting or Pass 1 extraction.

secondary_clouds.evidence: No secondary cloud services are mentioned.

processing_paradigm.evidence: Responsibilities involve building pipelines, web‑scraping, and scheduled model training rather than real‑time streaming.

orchestrator_category.evidence: No orchestration tools (Airflow, dbt, etc.) are cited.

storage_layer.evidence: The posting does not specify data warehouses, lakes, or lakehouses.

remote_restriction.evidence: Allowed countries are Argentina, Brazil, Colombia, Chile, Mexico, Dominican Republic – all in the Latin America region.

timezone_focus.evidence: Company notes meetings often happen in US time zones and the allowed countries are in the Americas.

relocation_required.evidence: Role is fully remote with "Work from Anywhere" and no relocation clause.

h1b_friendly.evidence: Visa sponsorship is not mentioned in the posting.

opt_cpt_friendly.evidence: No reference to OPT/CPT eligibility; only work‑authorization language is absent.

citizenship_required.evidence: No citizenship or work‑authorization restrictions are stated; only country‑based remote eligibility is listed.

w2_vs_1099.evidence: Employment type is listed as "contract" and compensation is described as contractor‑based.

benefits_level.evidence: Benefits include language classes, paid vacation, parental leave, and hardware reimbursement – typical standard package.

growth_path_clarity.evidence: The posting mentions building a team and growth opportunities but does not define explicit career tracks.

mentorship_signals.evidence: Collaboration with senior domain experts and engineers is highlighted, implying informal mentorship.

promotion_path_mentioned.evidence: No language about promotion or advancement paths appears in the posting.

internal_mobility_mentioned.evidence: The posting does not reference internal transfers or lateral moves.

career_tracks_available.evidence: No specific career tracks (IC, management, specialist, architect) are described.

requirement_strictness.evidence: A clear set of must‑have hard and soft skills is listed alongside a short nice‑to‑have list.

scope_definition.evidence: Job description focuses specifically on data‑science modeling and pipeline work without mixing other roles.

skill_inflation_detected.evidence: Required experience (3+ years) aligns with the listed technical skill set; no unrealistic senior‑level expectations for a mid‑senior role.
